title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: Can Australia Pull Off Barring Children From Social Media?
items.description: A law that restricts social media use to people 16 and over goes into effect in December, but much about it remains unclear or undecided.

items.title: At least 43 dead in catastrophic Texas flooding and dozens missing from girls camp
items.description: Flash flooding slammed the Texas Hill Country overnight on Friday. At least 27 girls from a summer camp next to the Guadalupe River remain missing.

items.title: Albert Ojwang Was Killed in Police Custody. Kenyans Are Not About to Let It Go.
items.description: At the funeral for Albert Ojwang, protesters in Kenya said his death was a call to action for the country’s youth.

items.title: Texas Flood Victims: What We Know
items.description: Child and adult campers and a camp director were among at least 51 people who have died in the flooding in Central Texas.

items.title: Ozzy Osbourne Plays His ‘Final Song’ With Black Sabbath
items.description: The metal luminary, 76, took the stage with his original bandmates at a farewell festival in his Birmingham, England, hometown on Saturday night.

items.title: Can Australia Pull Off Barring Children From Social Media?
items.description: A law that restricts social media use to people 16 and over goes into effect in December, but much about it remains unclear or undecided.

items.title: Why the Dalai Lama’s Succession Is Complicated
items.description: Just before the Dalai Lama turned 90, he announced that his successor would be selected through the traditional process of reincarnation. Mujib Mashal...

items.title: How to Make Better Decisions, According to a Neuroscientist
items.description: Making decisions that align long-term goals and short-term rewards is challenging, but it can lead to better choices and richer lives.

items.title: Albert Ojwang Was Killed in Police Custody. Kenyans Are Not About to Let It Go.
items.description: At the funeral for Albert Ojwang, protesters in Kenya said his death was a call to action for the country’s youth.

items.title: The Little Mountain Democracy That Sustains Tibet’s Refugee Nation
items.description: The exile government that was built by the Dalai Lama to preserve Tibetans’ cultural identity will be put to the test by his eventual succession.

items.title: Photos:  Texas reels from deadly flooding
items.description: Gov. Greg Abbott says the state will work day and night to find people who may be stranded and unable to call for help.

items.title: Heat and wildfire smoke affect birth outcomes, according to a new study
items.description: Heat and wildfire smoke affect birth outcomes, according to a new study of women in Los Angeles.

items.title: Cuts to HIV research funding in the US impacts progress towards ending the epidemic
items.description: How will the Trump administration's cuts to HIV research impact the progress that's been made towards ending the epidemic in the U.S.?

items.title: Khamenei Appears in Public for First Time Since Israel War Began
items.description: The long absence of Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, from public life had fueled speculation about his health and threats to his life.
